description:
This sound shows an automatic door opening when someone pass through it. We can listen some wind and background noise.
The sound was recorded asking to someone to go out to the street using the automatic door using Edirol R09HR equipment in format .wav and 44.1 kHz.
It was recorded in the entrance of Tallers building in Campus Poblenou, UPF.

name: Leather Sofa, Sit Down, Stand Up
iPhone_Texting.wav
description: You don't need to credit me, however you can credit iPhone/Apple if you want to! -------------------------------------------------------------- My two nieces, two Tiktokers, came by and sat on the sofa in my room. They both have iPhone and they were texting their friends, so I took the opportunity to record some! We all tried to be as quiet as possible during the recording! I could've made a real clean-up on this sound, however I didn't, because it sounded good enough imo! If you enjoyed the sound, please RATE, COMMENT, SPREAD! It really helps! NOTE: Make sure to check out the other MATRIXXX-sounds! The sound quality is always better when you download the sound(s)! ⛄ Enjoy! /MATRIXXX

name: Tornado Closet Thunderstorm
description: This was recorded while sitting in a closet during a tornado warning as a thunder-storm raged outside the house. It was recorded on April 28, 2020 in Tulsa, Oklahoma. There are several very low frequency booms from the deep thunder. You can hear the faint sound of tornado sirens blaring outside. There is also the intermittent sound of panicked breathing by one of the two dogs that were also riding out the storm, sheltered in the closet. A thunderbolt rattles some wood hangers on the hanger rod.

name: Janitor's Closet Ambience
description:
I don't know if this is technically a Janitor's closet, persay, but it's some sort of closet with lots of cleaning stuff and electronics. It always makes a very lovely sound. 

Part of a collection of sounds I recorded at an elementary school after the students have finished the year--the building was largely empty and as I've worked here, I've noticed a range of interesting sounds that I thought would be useful for folks working with video games or audio dramas! No need to credit me, but would be interested to know what you use it for just out of my own curiosity.

name: Sounds For Earthquakes - Closet Shaking 2.wav
